title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Reverting a file in the Java editor is significantly slower than closing and reopening the file.
OB:
When performing the following steps:
- Opening an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java'
- Making the file dirty by adding a space character at the end of the first line

It takes approximately 8 seconds to:
1. Click on the close box in the editor tab
2. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
3. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

However, when selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after repeating steps 1 and 2, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The time it takes to revert a file using the 'Revert' option from the pop-up menu in the Java editor should be similar to closing and reopening the file, around 8 seconds.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java'
2. Add a space character at the end of the first line to make the file dirty
3. Click on the close box in the editor tab
4. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
5. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it

Note the time it takes for the file to reopen. Then, repeat steps 1 and 2, and instead of closing and reopening the file, select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.

Note the time it takes for the file contents to be replaced with the original.
